Update Graph Info

_update_graph_info(self, graph)

TODO: Add function description

Parameters

graph – A DGL graph object

Return type

GraphInfo tuple, bool

source code for _update_graph_info()
 1def _update_graph_info(self, graph):
 2    reset = False
 3
 4    if not (self._graph_info_cache != None
 5            and self._graph_info_cache.number_of_nodes == graph.number_of_nodes()
 6            and self._graph_info_cache.number_of_edges == graph.number_of_edges()):
 7
 8        in_csr = graph.get_in_csr()
 9        out_csr = graph.get_out_csr()
10
11        self._graph_info_cache = Context.GraphInfo(
12            graph.number_of_nodes(),
13            graph.number_of_edges(),
14            in_csr(0).copy_to_gpu(0),
15            in_csr(1).copy_to_gpu(0),
16            in_csr(2).copy_to_gpu(0),
17            out_csr(0).copy_to_gpu(0),
18            out_csr(1).copy_to_gpu(0),
19            out_csr(2).copy_to_gpu(0),
20            graph.nbits())
21
22        reset = True
23
24    return self._graph_info_cache, reset

Function Overview

2reset = False

If reset is set to false, then the _graph_info_cache is not updated. Else it will be updated.

2if not (self._graph_info_cache != None
3            and self._graph_info_cache.number_of_nodes == graph.number_of_nodes()
4            and self._graph_info_cache.number_of_edges == graph.number_of_edges()):

The if-block is executed if atleast one of the following conditions are True:

  1. _graph_info_cache is None

  2. _graph_info_cache.number_of_nodes != graph.number_of_nodes()

  3. _graph_info_cache.number_of_edges != graph.number_of_edges()

todo explanation
8in_csr = graph.get_in_csr()
9out_csr = graph.get_out_csr()

11self._graph_info_cache = Context.GraphInfo(
12        graph.number_of_nodes(),
13        graph.number_of_edges(),
14        in_csr(0).copy_to_gpu(0),
15        in_csr(1).copy_to_gpu(0),
16        in_csr(2).copy_to_gpu(0),
17        out_csr(0).copy_to_gpu(0),
18        out_csr(1).copy_to_gpu(0),
19        out_csr(2).copy_to_gpu(0),
20        graph.nbits())
21
22    reset = True

nbits is the number of integer bits used in the storage (32 or 64). _graph_info_cache is now the namedtuple GraphInfo. reset is now set to True, because _graph_info_cache was changed.
